entries.content: User Moti requested CSS best practice refactor memory search. Found extensive CSS refactoring work from recent sessions - ultra-modular architecture pattern with orchestrator imports appears to be our established standard.
Planning ultra-modular refactor for ui-user-input.css - analyzing file structure and identifying concerns to apply orchestrator pattern

Analyzing ui-user-input.css (457 lines) - identified 8 distinct concerns: container layout, message input, input actions, action buttons, send button, stop button state, search button, clipboard widgets, and image gallery. Checking theme system for existing reusable components.

Successfully completed ultra-modular refactor of ui-user-input.css (457 lines â†’ 35 lines = 92% reduction). Created 8 focused modules in user-input/ subdirectory + 2 new reusable theme components (action-buttons.css, button-states.css). Applied proven orchestrator pattern with sub-orchestrator for clean two-level organization.

When using PowerShell with variable assignments in Bash tool, the bash environment interprets the $ sign differently. Better to use simple dir commands or avoid complex PowerShell variable syntax in bash tool invocations.
